{"id":1191613306,"question_id":3332,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"3 months, 1 week","timestamp":1709390694,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1191613306/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Operations to Exceed Threshold Value II","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\n    public int minOperations(int[] nums, int k) {\n           \n        TreeMap<Integer, Integer> map = new TreeMap<>();\n        \n        for(int n : nums){\n            map.put(n, map.getOrDefault(n,0)+1);\n        }\n        \n        int cnt = nums.length;\n        \n        \n        int res= 0 ;\n        while(map.firstKey()<k && cnt>=2){\n            \n            int x = map.firstKey();\n            map.put(x, map.get(x)-1);\n            if(map.get(x)==0)\n                map.remove(x);\n            \n            int y = map.firstKey();\n            map.put(y, map.get(y)-1);\n            if(map.get(y)==0)\n                map.remove(y);\n            \n            int add = Math.min(x, y)*2 + Math.max(x,y);\n            map.put(add, map.getOrDefault(add,0)+1);\n            \n            // System.out.println(x+ \" \" + y + \" \" + map.keySet());\n            \n//             int z = map.firstKey();\n//             map.put(z, map.get(z)-1);\n//             if(map.get(z)==0)\n//                 map.remove(z);\n            \n            \n            cnt-=1;\n            res++;\n        }\n        \n        \n        return res;\n        \n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-operations-to-exceed-threshold-value-ii","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
